articles.title: Madras High Court Refuses To Cancel Interim Bail Of YouTuber Savukku Shankar, But Imposes Extra Conditions
articles.summary: The Madras High Court, on Friday, refused to cancel the interim bail granted to YouTuber Journalist Savukku Shankar in an extortion case. The court, however, imposed additional conditions on his bail. The bench of Justice P Velmurugan and Justice M Jothiraman has asked Shankar not to make any statement, either directly or indirectly, in connection with the case, including comments against the conduct of the officers. The court has also asked Shankar not to interact with or intimidate the co-accu

articles.summary: The Delhi High Court has listed for hearing on January 28 a plea filed by Congress MP Karti P Chindambaram challenging a trial court order framing charges against him in connection with the Chinese visa scam case. The matter was listed today before Justice Girish Kathpalia . However, the judge recused, citing personal reasons. articles.title: Registered Sale Deed Has Strong Presumption Of Genuineness, Cannot Be Lightly Called 'Sham': Supreme Court
articles.summary: The Supreme Court held that a registered sale deed carries a greater presumption of validity and genuineness, and therefore cannot be lightly declared as 'sham' to oppose the sale transaction. “It is a settled position of law that a registered Sale Deed carries with it a formidable presumption of validity and genuineness. articles.summary: The Allahabad High Court has held that before issuing a direction to send a child to boarding school amid custody battle between parents, psychologically evaluation of the child is necessary to ascertain whether such child can handle the separation from the parent he/ she has been living with. The parties had challenged a single judge order which held that bike taxis cannot operate in the state unless the State government issues relevant guidelines and rules under the Motor Vehicles Act. A division bench of Chief Justice Vibhu Bakhru and Justice CM Joshi today said: " In view of the above taxi owners are at

articles.title: Kerala Court Sentences Woman Who Threw One-Year-Old Son Into Sea To Undergo Life Imprisonment
articles.summary: The Additional District and Sessions Court, Taliparamba on Thursday (January 22) sentenced Saranya Valsaraj to life imprisonment for committing the murder of her one-and-a-half-year-old son, Viyan, in 2020. Additional District and Sessions Judge, Sri. Prasanth K.N. found Saranya guilty of Section 302 of the Indian Penal Code, finding that her guilt was proved beyond any reasonable doubt. The court observed: “ The prosecution has succeeded in proving the chain of circumstances that corroborates t

articles.title: Wife Can't Claim Maintenance If Her Own Acts Rendered Husband Incapable Of Earning: Allahabad High Court
articles.summary: The Allahabad High Court has held that if a wife, by her own acts or omissions, causes or contributes to the incapacity of her husband to earn, she cannot be permitted to take advantage of such a situation and claim maintenance. A bench of Justice Lakshmi Kant Shukla ruled that granting maintenance in such a scenario would result in “grave injustice”, particularly when the husband's earning capacity was destroyed by the criminal acts of the wife's family. The Court added that while in Indian soc

articles.title: Chhattisgarh High Court Grants ₹1 Lakh Compensation To Law Student Arrested Illegally & 'Mechanically' Remanded To Judicial Custody
articles.summary: The Chhattisgarh High Court on Wednesday (January 21) ordered the State to pay Rs. 1 Lakh compensation to a law student who was illegally arrested by the police without registration of any FIR and mechanically remanded to judicial custody bereft of any cognizable offence. Emphasizing the value of personal liberty and dignity, the Division Bench of Chief Justice Ramesh Sinha and Justice Ravindra Kumar Agrawal remarked – “…we have no hesitation in holding that the petitioner, along with his parent

articles.title: Venezuela And The Limits Of International Law's Hollow Core
articles.summary: The recent interventionist posture adopted by the United States in Venezuela has laid bare a truth long articulated by critics of international law but seldom confronted with such clarity: when confronted with hegemonic will, international law ceases to function as a constraint and survives only as rhetoric. What is unfolding in Venezuela is not merely a regional crisis or a contested foreign policy decision; it is a case study in the structural futility of international law when power decides t

articles.summary: The Madras High Court recently criticised the State for collecting sensitive data of students who had stigmatic background. Justice G Jayachandran and Justice KK Ramakrishnan set aside an order passed by the Member Secretary of the Model School, calling for certain information of students. The court noted that the information was sensitive and there was no explanation on how this data was going to be used or stored. Calling it a violation of the privacy of students, the court noted that it would

articles.title: Use Of AI-Generated Fake Citations Doesn't Vitiate Order If Correct Law Applied: Andhra Pradesh High Court
articles.summary: The Andhra Pradesh High Court has observed that mere mention of non-existent citations generated by Artificial Intelligence (AI) in a judicial order would not vitiate it, if the law considered is correct and there is no fault in its application to the facts. The Court observed so while dismissing the challenge to a Trial Court order, where the judicial officer had, while upholding an advocate commissioner's report, relied on certain AI generated citations without verification, resulting in the i

articles.summary: The Rajasthan High Court�has set aside the disciplinary action against a government officer stopping his 100% pension for life, which was solely based on statements of a person given to the police under Section 161 CrPC who was neither examined during the departmental enquiry nor before court. articles.title: Notice Invalid as Limitation Exhausted Despite Section 148A Process
articles.summary: The case examined whether procedural compliance under section 148A could revive a time-barred reopening. It was held that procedural steps cannot resurrect jurisdiction lost by efflux of time. The post Notice Invalid as Limitation Exhausted Despite Section 148A Process appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Bogus Purchases: ITAT Mumbai Restricts Addition to 5% Where Sales Are Undisputed
articles.summary: The issue was whether a flat 12.5% disallowance on alleged bogus purchases was justified. The Tribunal ruled that when sales are accepted and books are not rejected, only a lower, reasonable estimation can apply, capping it at 5%. The post Bogus Purchases: ITAT Mumbai Restricts Addition to 5% Where Sales Are Undisputed appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 54 Deduction Allowed Even If Original Return Was Not Filed: ITAT Mumbai
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that a Section 54 exemption can be claimed in a reassessment return if it directly relates to escaped income. Delay or non-filing of the original return under Section 139(1) alone cannot defeat a substantive deduction. The post Section 54 Deduction Allowed Even If Original Return Was Not Filed: ITAT Mumbai appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Quashed for Not Supplying Recorded Reasons
articles.summary: The issue was whether reassessment can proceed without furnishing recorded reasons despite a taxpayers request. The Tribunal held that failure to supply reasons is a jurisdictional defect that invalidates reassessment. The post Reassessment Quashed for Not Supplying Recorded Reasons appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 69 Not Applicable to Recorded Share Investments
articles.summary: The issue was whether a recorded share investment can be treated as unexplained under Section 69. The Tribunal held that once an investment is recorded in the books and its source is not doubted, Section 69 cannot be invoked. The post Section 69 Not Applicable to Recorded Share Investments appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Survey Income Declared in Return Not Liable to 270A Penalty
articles.summary: The issue was whether income disclosed during survey and duly reported in the return can attract penalty under Section 270A. The Tribunal held that when returned income equals assessed income, penalty provisions do not apply. The post Survey Income Declared in Return Not Liable to 270A Penalty appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ₹2 Crore Section 69 Addition Quashed Due to Uncorroborated Loose Sheets
articles.summary: The Tribunal ruled that reopening beyond six years is invalid without a recorded satisfaction of undisclosed assets exceeding ₹50 lakh. The takeaway is strict compliance with the fourth proviso to section 153A is mandatory. The post ₹2 Crore Section 69 Addition Quashed Due to Uncorroborated Loose Sheets appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Fails When Based Only on Third-Party Claims
articles.summary: The reassessment relied entirely on allegations arising from a search on another entity. The Tribunal ruled that additions cannot survive without independent evidence directly linking the assessee. The post Reassessment Fails When Based Only on Third-Party Claims appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 69 On-Money Additions Quashed for Natural Justice Breach
articles.summary: The case examined additions made in Section 153C assessments based on third-party search material. The Tribunal ruled that additions cannot stand unless incriminating documents are furnished to the assessee. The post Section 69 On-Money Additions Quashed for Natural Justice Breach appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Quashed for Failure to Record Reasons Under Section 148
articles.summary: The issue was whether reassessment is valid when reasons for reopening are not placed on record. The Tribunal held that non-recording of reasons under Section 148(2) vitiates jurisdiction, rendering the reassessment void. The post Reassessment Quashed for Failure to Record Reasons Under Section 148 appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: How Capital Gains Tax Differs Across ETFs, Equity and Mutual Funds
articles.summary: This explains how different securities are taxed under Indian income-tax law. The key takeaway is that asset classification, not just holding period, determines the tax rate. The post How Capital Gains Tax Differs Across ETFs, Equity and Mutual Funds appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ITAT Hyderabad Condoned 506-Day Delay; Ad Spend Allowed; Alleged Coerced Share Sale Ground Admitted
articles.summary: The Tribunal condoned a 506-day delay after accepting that the appeal was filed only when heavy penalty exposure created prosecution risk. The key takeaway is that bona fide reliance on legal advice and later developments can constitute sufficient cause for condonation. The post ITAT Hyderabad Condoned 506-Day Delay; Ad Spend Allowed; Alleged Coerced Share Sale Ground Admitted appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: CA Withdraws Appeal as Final Removal Order Not First Challenged Before Single Judge
articles.summary: The High Court held that a direct appellate challenge to the final removal order was not maintainable. The appeal was withdrawn with liberty to file a fresh writ against the removal order. The post CA Withdraws Appeal as Final Removal Order Not First Challenged Before Single Judge appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Service Tax Demand After Death Unsustainable; Legal Heir Not Covered u/s 65(7): Orissa HC
articles.summary: Orissa High Court held that legal heir cannot fall within ken of Section 65(7) of the Finance Act, 1994 hence proceedings under section 73 of the Finance Act determining service tax after the death of the service provider is unsustainable in law. Accordingly, the present writ petition is allowed. The post Service Tax Demand After Death Unsustainable; Legal Heir Not Covered u/s 65(7): Orissa HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Trump backpedals on threats against Greenland, but allies say damage has been done

Even as the president has taken an off-ramp, many Europeans and Canadians say the damage has already been done. Nick Schifrin reports.

articles.title: Amazon job cuts 2026: Etailer to start cutting thousands of corporate roles in coming days
articles.summary: Layoffs at Amazon: This comes soon after Amazon trimmed about 14,000 white-collar positions in October as part of a broader restructuring exercise to eliminate 30,000 corporate roles. The upcoming layoffs, which could reportedly begin as soon as Tuesday, may match that scale. This will impact Amazon Web Services (AWS), retail, Prime Video, and the People Experience and Technology (PXT) units, though the exact scope is unclear.

articles.title: Who owns TikTok in the US now?
articles.summary: Under the arrangement, non-Chinese investors will own about 80% of the American venture. ByteDance will keep 19.9% of it. The investors, who could potentially have outsize influence on the popular social media platform, will license the app's powerful recommendation algorithm from ByteDance and have the power to moderate content on the app.

articles.title: TikTok: key things to know about the video sharing platform
articles.summary: Video-sharing platform TikTok has over a billion users worldwide, including more than 170 million in the United States, it says -- nearly half the country's population. The platform has faced scrutiny worldwide, particularly in the United States, over data privacy and potential ties to the Chinese government, including accusations of spying and propaganda.

articles.title: Intel struggles to meet AI data center demand as PC chip squeezes margins
articles.summary: The forecast underscores the difficulties faced by Intel in predicting global chip markets, where the company's current products are the result of decisions made years ago. The company, whose shares have risen 40% in the past month, recently launched a long-awaited laptop chip designed to reclaim its ‌lead in personal computers just ‌as a memory chip crunch is expected to depress sales across that industry.

articles.title: Amazon plans second round of 30,000 corporate job cuts next week, sources say
articles.summary: Amazon is planning a second round of job cuts next week ‍as part of its broader goal ​of trimming some 30,000 corporate workers. The company in October cut some 14,000 white-collar jobs, about half of the 30,000 target.

articles.title: India hums ‘har ek country zaroori hota hai’ tune as tariffs bite
articles.summary: Facing global trade shifts and tariff pressures, India is urging its embassies to boost outreach in all markets, emphasizing that "every country matters." The PMO has directed missions to diversify exports by engaging with even smaller economies, recognizing their potential for future growth and integration into global supply chains.

articles.title: Budget 2025: From farms to factories, a people-centric road map for Viksit Bharat
articles.summary: Budget 2025: At the core of the Budget was the vision of Viksit Bharat -- anchored in eliminating poverty, ensuring quality education for all, providing affordable healthcare and creating full employment through skills. It also sought to increase women’s participation in the economy and position farmers as key contributors to global food security.

articles.title: India–EU trade marathon likely set for a Tuesday finish
articles.summary: India and the European Union are poised to announce the conclusion of long-running free trade negotiations, a deal expected to reduce tariffs on European automobiles and wine while widening market access for Indian exports such as electronics, textiles and chemicals. The agreement is likely to be

articles.title: Stable policy environment, reforms driving India's growth: India envoy Pratik Mathur in Shanghai
articles.summary: India's stable policy and reform-oriented investment climate have propelled it to become the world's fastest-growing major economy. Initiatives like Make in India and Digital India, alongside inclusive AI policies, are driving this growth and fostering a vibrant startup ecosystem.

articles.title: How labour codes impact salaries & social security
articles.summary: India's new labour laws, effective November 21, 2025, redefine 'wages' for statutory benefits, impacting salary structures and social security calculations like gratuity and leave encashment. While some allowances remain tax-efficient, employers must ensure at least half of gross salary meets the new wage definition, promoting transparency in compensation.

articles.title: Govt approves wage revision of PSU general insurers, NABARD, RBI employees, pensioners
articles.summary: The central government has approved significant wage and pension revisions. This benefits over 46,000 employees and 23,000 pensioners across PSU General Insurance companies, NABARD, and RBI. Wage revisions for PSU General Insurance companies are effective from August 1, 2022. NABARD's payment revision starts November 1, 2022. RBI and NABARD retirees will see pension enhancements from November 1, 2022.

articles.title: India scraps more South American soy oil cargoes as rupee slumps
articles.summary: Rupee fall: The latest development comes after Indian buyers backed out of more than 100,000 tons of Argentinian deals in December, equivalent to roughly 20% of what the country imports in a month. India relies on overseas purchases for nearly 60% of its edible oil consumption.

articles.title: Budget 2026 must prioritise job creation, support to exports: FICCI's Industry Survey
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: Businesses are calling for the Budget to focus on creating jobs and boosting exports. Global trade challenges are a key concern. Companies are optimistic about India's economic future. They expect strong GDP growth and support for sectors like manufacturing and defence. Fiscal prudence remains important. The budget will be presented on February 1.

articles.title: India deeply engaged on trade matters: Vaishnaw on Trump's remarks on US deal
articles.summary: Following Donald Trump's optimistic statement about a "good" trade deal with India, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw expressed encouragement, highlighting India's significant role in global trade. Trump, speaking at the World Economic Forum, praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a "fantastic man" and a friend, underscoring his respect for the Indian leader.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Exporters seek tax, tariff relief on February 1
articles.summary: India Budget: Indian exporters are calling for government support in the upcoming Union Budget 2026-27. They seek tax, tariff, and financing measures to combat global protectionism and revive export growth. Key demands include correcting inverted customs duty structures and developing Indian shipping lines. These steps aim to reduce costs, boost competitiveness, and strengthen India's position in international trade.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Industry leaders urge govt to double infra spending to Rs 3 lakh crore
articles.summary: Union Budget of India: Industry leaders are urging the government to double infrastructure project allocations to Rs 3 lakh crore in the upcoming Budget. This significant increase is seen as crucial for boosting economic growth, enhancing supply-chain efficiency, and positioning India as a global economic powerhouse. Key demands include reforms in logistics, warehousing, cold-chain, and renewable energy infrastructure.

articles.title: ET@DAVOS: How Geopolitics, Agentic AI, and Gen Z talent are rewriting the growth playbook
Budget 2026 could drive a power shift in India’s semiconductor push
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: The nation aims to become a top chip manufacturing hub by 2032. Several major projects are underway, with production expected to start in 2026. The budget must ensure sustained policy support and timely incentive disbursements to maintain momentum and attract further investment in this crucial sector.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Fiscal policy to turn pro-growth as government moves to target debt-to-GDP, economists say
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: India's fiscal policy is set to favor growth as the government shifts its focus to a debt-to-GDP ratio target from April 2026. This move is expected to lead to a gentler pace of fiscal tightening. Economists anticipate gross borrowings to reach record highs, though net borrowings may remain stable, potentially impacting bond markets.

articles.title: Adani Green Q3 Results: Company reports loss of Rs 41 crore vs Rs 492 crore profit a year ago
articles.summary: Adani Green Q3 Results: Adani Green reported a net loss of Rs 41 crore in the December quarter, a shift from last year's profit. Despite this, total income climbed 8% year-on-year to Rs 2,837 crore. The company's power supply segment saw robust growth, with revenue up 21% and EBITDA by 23%, fueled by significant greenfield capacity additions and new project commissioning.

articles.title: Vedanta shares rise 3%, hit record high as LME copper, aluminium prices gain. Will stock hit Rs 800?
articles.summary: Shares of Anil Agarwal-led Vedanta Ltd rallied as much as 3% to their fresh 52-week high of Rs 699 on the BSE on Friday after copper prices bounced back to inch closer to its fresh high of $13,407 on the London Metal Exchange. Zinc prices also edged higher by about a percent.

articles.title: Shriram Finance Q3 Results: PAT falls 29% YoY to Rs 2,522 crore, NII rises 16%
articles.summary: Shriram Finance Q3 results: Shriram Finance reported a 29% YoY fall in its December quarter standalone net profit at Rs 2,522 crore compared to Rs 3,570 crore reported in the year ago period.

articles.title: Rupee plummets to fresh record low of 91.95 vs USD as dollar demand strengthens
articles.summary: ​The Indian ⁠rupee plunged to a fresh ‌all-time ‌low on ‌Friday, as dollar demand from corporates and ​importers ​outweighed early ‌moves ‍and ‍compounded existing pressure on the ‌currency.

articles.title: Rs 6 lakh cr wiped out! Sensex slumps over 800 points, Nifty below 25,050. What triggered the selloff?
articles.summary: Indian equities experienced a sharp decline on Friday, with the Sensex and Nifty erasing early gains due to persistent foreign institutional investor (FII) selling. FIIs offloaded equities worth Rs 2,550 crore on Thursday, marking the 13th consecutive session of net selling in January, significantly impacting market sentiment and capitalization.

articles.title: Cipla Q3 Results: Net profit plunges 57% YoY to Rs 676 crore
articles.summary: Cipla Q3 Results: Cipla reported a 57% YoY drop in net profit to Rs 676 crore, impacted by lower gRevlimid sales in North America. Despite this, the company's One India business saw double-digit growth in branded prescriptions, and upcoming launches are expected to offset future revenue declines.

articles.title: Adani Enterprises, Adani Power and other group stocks suffer Rs 1.1 lakh crore shock, sink up to 11%. Here's what went wrong
articles.summary: Adani Group stocks tumbled up to 11% after the US SEC sought court permission to email summons to Gautam Adani and Sagar Adani regarding an alleged $265 million bribery scheme. India had previously rejected official requests for service, citing procedural grounds. The SEC is pursuing the case, which involves allegations of bribing Indian officials and misleading US investors.

articles.title: Paytm shares tumble 10%, down in 4 out of 5 sessions. Company clarifies on recent reports
articles.summary: Paytm Share Price: Paytm's stock experienced a significant drop due to market worries about the Payment Infrastructure Development Fund. This scheme's potential discontinuation could impact digital payment providers. However, a brokerage firm has initiated coverage with a positive outlook, forecasting substantial growth. Meanwhile, domestic mutual funds have reduced their holdings in Paytm for the first time since its debut.

articles.title: Largecap IT looks safer than midcaps; IndiGo correction offers upside: Sandip Sabharwal
articles.summary: Market expert Sandip Sabharwal highlights opportunities in strong large-cap stocks amidst volatility. He sees potential in InterGlobe Aviation due to its financial strength and market dominance. The IT sector offers moderate returns with improving order signings. Sabharwal advises extreme caution on financial stocks, especially after the IIFL episode.

articles.title: Insurance reforms could unlock vast growth opportunity: Dinesh Kumar Khara
articles.summary: India's insurance sector is set for a major transformation. New reforms are expected to bring global standards and boost insurance coverage across the nation. This move aims to address the current low penetration levels and offer better products to the public. The changes are designed to improve pricing and accessibility, paving the way for sustainable growth in the insurance industry.

articles.title: Adani Green Energy Q3 Results Live:  Company slips into the red, reports YoY loss of Rs 41 crore in December quarter
Bitcoin remains range-bound near $89,800 as investors look for cues
articles.summary: Bitcoin is trading in a narrow range near $89,800 as investors await fresh triggers. Analysts cite weak liquidity, ETF outflows and macro uncertainty, though price stability near $90,000 suggests underlying conviction remains intact despite broader market caution.

articles.title: Markets volatile, but earnings and structural story remain intact: Mayuresh Joshi
articles.summary: Indian equity markets show resilience despite recent incremental weakness, with the broader outlook dependent on earnings visibility and global developments. While current earnings are mixed, a rebound is anticipated later in the year, driven by inventory rationalization and stronger growth expectations. Global events, particularly US trade policy, remain a key overhang, though potential trade deals could boost sentiment.

articles.title: Why Central Bank Independence Matters: Global lessons as Trump targets Fed Governor
articles.summary: Central bank independence is crucial for economic stability, as it helps control inflation and maintain confidence. Research shows that political interference in monetary policy often leads to higher inflation, currency weakness and slower growth.

articles.title: FII selling, weak rupee and oil prices drag Indian markets, but long-term  story intact: Mark Mobius
articles.summary: Mark Mobius says India’s recent market correction is driven by FII outflows, weak rupee, higher oil prices and global uncertainty, not a broken growth story. He expects earnings-led FII return, reforms and infrastructure push in the Budget, stays bullish on India over China long term, and recommends equities alongside gold and silver for diversification.

articles.title: Rupee rises 17 paise to 91.41 against US dollar in early trade
articles.summary: The Indian Rupee saw a gain of 17 paise against the US Dollar today. This rise was driven by improved investor sentiment following a de-escalation of trade war fears. The Dollar corrected, allowing emerging market currencies like the Rupee to recover. However, persistent foreign fund outflows and global uncertainties continue to pressure the Rupee.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Can a reduction in LTCG unleash a bull market in Indian stocks?
articles.summary: Budget 2026 approaches with discussions on reducing capital gains tax for equities. While some believe it could boost investor sentiment after a year of muted returns and foreign investor selling, market experts suggest it may only offer marginal help. Global factors and corporate earnings growth are seen as more significant drivers for a sustained stock market rally.

articles.title: Digital Real Estate | Housing cycle loses momentum in CY25 as affordability pressures mount: Nuvama
articles.summary: India’s housing cycle weakened in CY25 as affordability pressures and a shift toward luxury homes hit demand. Nuvama reports the sharpest quarterly sales drop since CY21, with volumes declining across major cities. Stable inventory kept prices firm, prompting caution on realty stocks and favouring annuity-led players like Prestige Estates.

articles.title: What Goldman Sachs, Jefferies, HSBC, 5 others expect from Union Budget FY27
articles.summary: As the Union Budget FY27 nears, financial experts anticipate a careful balance between fiscal discipline and economic growth. Key expectations include sustained capital expenditure, particularly in infrastructure and defence, alongside conservative tax policies. Investors will closely watch measures aimed at boosting consumption, manufacturing, and exports, while the fiscal deficit remains a critical market indicator.

articles.title: Rs 4.5 lakh crore PSU bank rally draws FII buying in 10 stocks. Are you late to the party?
articles.summary: Foreign investors are significantly increasing their stakes in Indian public sector banks, drawn by a remarkable rally and improving financial health. These banks are now outperforming private lenders in loan growth, signaling a strong turnaround. Despite recent gains, analysts believe many PSU banks still offer attractive valuations, making them a compelling investment opportunity.

articles.title: KEI Industries among 5 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open Interest
articles.summary: KEI Industries saw a sharp surge in futures open interest, emerging among five F O stocks signaling rising trader interest and potential near-term volatility.

articles.title: APL Apollo Tubes, two other stocks flash bullish signals, indicating an uptrend
articles.summary: A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern that forms when the opening price is the lowest and the closing price is the highest for a given session.

articles.title: United Spirits shares in focus after Adar Poonawalla signals bid for RCB acquisition
articles.summary: United Spirits shares are set to be in focus after Serum Institute CEO Adar Poonawalla said he plans to make a strong and competitive bid for the Royal Challengers Bengaluru IPL franchise, currently owned by the Diageo-controlled liquor maker. The development comes against the backdrop of a sharp rise in United Spirits’ December-quarter profit, even as revenue growth remained modest.

articles.title: Stock market may stay range-bound near term, but new highs likely by year-end: Nitin Raheja
articles.summary: Indian equities are navigating a period of consolidation with improving growth prospects for FY27. While near-term market movements may be range-bound, a stronger earnings recovery could propel indices to new highs by year-end. Valuations have become more attractive compared to other emerging markets, offering a better risk-reward setup.

articles.title: Don’t chase gold rally, gradual allocation beats momentum investing; volatility risk rising: Chintan Haria
articles.summary: Gold’s early-2026 rally is being driven by strong investor flows and portfolio reallocation, says ICICI Prudential AMC’s Chintan Haria. While the long-term case for gold remains intact due to low allocations and dollar concerns, he cautions that much of the positive news is priced in, implying slower gains and higher volatility ahead.

articles.title: ETBudget Boardroom| Budget 2026 should focus on continuity, bond market development and funding India’s growth internally: A Balasubramanian
articles.summary: India's economic resilience amidst global turmoil is highlighted, with policy continuity, bond market development, and domestic funding mechanisms identified as key Budget priorities. The nation's fiscal consolidation and real asset creation provide a strong foundation for sustained growth, positioning it favorably for future expansion.

articles.title: ETMarkets Smart Talk| Budget 2026 to prioritise capex and policy continuity over big-bang reforms: Niraj Kumar
articles.summary: Budget 2026 is expected to prioritize growth support and macro stability, with a focus on capital expenditure and fiscal discipline. Niraj Kumar of Generali Central Life Insurance anticipates a revival in earnings growth, driven by domestic demand and policy continuity, making India structurally well-placed despite geopolitical uncertainties.

articles.title: Bharat Electronics among 6 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
articles.summary: An uptrend signal is generated when the RSI crosses above 50 from below.

articles.title: DLF shares gain over 1% after turning gross debt-free, Q3 net profit rises 14% YoY
articles.summary: DLF shares are in focus after a strong Q3 performance. The company reported a 14.4% jump in net profit to Rs 1,207 crore. DLF also achieved a significant milestone by becoming gross debt-free for the first time since its 2007 IPO. Strong operating performance and consistent growth from its annuity business contributed to these positive results.

articles.title: Ex-Flipkart CTO Peeyush Ranjan launches edtech startup Fermi.ai
articles.summary: The startup was incubated at Myntra founder Mukesh Bansal’s Meraki Labs, where Ranjan also serves as a partner. Covering subjects such as mathematics, physics, and chemistry, the AI tutor will guide students to solutions.

articles.title: When AI becomes a teammate: Insights from Atlassian’s Team on Tour Bengaluru
articles.summary: Atlassian’s Team on Tour: Bengaluru brought together product leaders, partners, and customers for a one-day, invite-only deep dive into what it really means to make AI a “trusted teammate” at work. Discover the key highlights here.

articles.title: Elon Musk forecasts AI will be smarter than all of humanity collectively in five years
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is projected to surpass the collective intelligence of the entire human race within the next five years, said Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla, Chief Engineer at SpaceX, and CTO of xAI at the World Economic Forum. Musk provided this timeline during a recent discussion with Laurence D. Fink, Chairman and CEO of BlackRock, regarding the acceleration of computational capabilities and the integration of autonomous systems into the economy.

articles.title: Juspay closes $50 million funding from WestBridge Capital; becomes first unicorn of 2026 as valuation hits $1.2 billion
articles.summary: Founded in 2012, Bengaluru-based Juspay powers payment systems for major global brands such as Amazon, Flipkart, Google, IndiGo, and Swiggy. The company said in a statement that it now processes over 300 million transactions daily, with annualised total payment volume exceeding $1 trillion.

articles.title: Intuitive Surgical beats quarterly estimates on demand for surgical robots
articles.summary: The medical device maker has ‌seen consistent ‌growth as hospitals work through a backlog of deferred procedures and ‌expand access to minimally invasive care.

articles.title: Go Digit Q3 net profit rises 18% to Rs 140 crore on premium growth
articles.summary: For the new-age insurance startup, gross written premium, which is the total premium collected before deducting expenses, climbed to Rs 2,909 crore from Rs 2,676 crore in the corresponding period of the previous year. Also, its net retention ratio fell to 73.8% from 83.8% a year earlier, indicating a higher proportion of risk being ceded to reinsurers.

articles.title: Why New Delhi isn’t losing sleep over the rupee
articles.summary: The Indian rupee is falling as foreign investors withdraw funds and the RBI sells dollars. A trade deal with the US could reverse this trend. India's economy is strong and can absorb higher import costs. The US focus on tariffs may keep oil prices low, aiding India's growth. Washington will eventually reconsider its tariff policy, benefiting the rupee.

articles.title: ETBudget Boardroom | Capex, R&D push and tax reforms key expectations from Budget 2026: Vikas Khemani
articles.summary: As India prepares for Budget 2026, Carnelian Asset Management's Vikas Khemani emphasizes sustained growth through enhanced capex execution and R&D investment. He advocates for meaningful tax reforms, including addressing double taxation on dividends and STT, to boost investor confidence and long-term momentum.

articles.title: View: India is cornered by China’s lock on tech
articles.summary: India-China trade: India's industrial growth faces a new challenge as China restricts technology transfers. This impacts key sectors like electric vehicles and energy storage, affecting major Indian conglomerates. Despite recent diplomatic overtures, Beijing's stance highlights a significant technology gap. India's 'Make in India' initiative struggles against this dominance.

articles.title: No refund if you cancel late. Railways tighten rules for Vande Bharat, Amrit Bharat trains: Check new norms here
articles.summary: New ticket cancellation rules are now in effect for Vande Bharat Sleeper and Amrit Bharat II trains. Passengers cancelling confirmed tickets less than eight hours before departure will receive no refund. This change aims to reduce last-minute cancellations and improve berth utilization. These premium trains operate on a 100% confirmed berth policy, unlike regular trains.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,500 amid trade worries and foreign selling
articles.summary: Indian stock markets continued their downward trend on Tuesday, with both the Sensex and Nifty experiencing a second consecutive session of declines. Investors are closely monitoring global trade uncertainties and ongoing foreign fund outflows, while the quarterly earnings season also captures market attention. The Sensex dropped over 300 points, and the Nifty 50 fell more than 90 points.

articles.title: Union agriculture minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan addresses media on VB-G Ram G Act | LIVE
Blackstone finalises structured investment deal in AI cloud startup Neysa
articles.summary: US firm Blackstone has finalised a structured investment in Mumbai-based AI cloud startup Neysa, initially putting in $50–75 million. The deal allows Blackstone to increase its stake to a controlling position if certain business milestones are met. Neysa was was last valued at $120-130 million, and has raised $50 million in funding across two rounds till now.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the Mightiest - How understanding fiscal policy & government spending will help you make money in the stock market
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. By now we have a fair idea how the RBI, with its control over interest rates and money supply, acts as a crucial hand on the economic tiller. There is, however, another hand at work, one that operates more directly: Fiscal policy. And this is the domain of the government. And it is expressed through the Union Budget, slated for February 1. Understanding the budget is thus crucial. In this series, Macro the

articles.title: IT sector poised for better days ahead, financials to outperform: Chakri Lokapriya
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are in a wait-and-watch mode, awaiting clarity on tariffs and the Union Budget's capital expenditure focus. CIO-Equities Chakri Lokapriya highlights selective opportunities in sectors like IT, metals, and banking, while advising caution on insurance and quick commerce due to persistent competitive pressures and margin concerns.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.title: Republic Day 2026: Is India celebrating its 77th or 78th Republic Day
articles.summary: This year, India will celebrate its 77th Republic Day, as the count begins from the first celebration in 1950. Last year, the country marked its 76th Republic Day. One should consider the number of times it's being observed rather than the number years elapsed.

articles.title: Paras Defence Q3 Results: Revenue growth of 24% but stock falls on narrowing margins
articles.summary: Paras Defence's margins for the quarter narrowed to 24.7% from 25.8% last year in the third quarter. Margins were impacted due to the increase in total expenses with regards to finance costs and employee benefit expenses.

articles.summary: The Tribunal examined whether prior approval under Section 153D was granted after due application of mind. It held that mechanical and routine approval invalidates the assessment, rendering the search assessment void. The post ITAT Delhi Quashes Search Assessments for Mechanical Approval u/s 153D; Entire Proceedings Held Non-Est appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Quashed for Invalid Sanction u/s 151: Approval by PCIT Instead of PCCIT Held Void
articles.summary: The reassessment was challenged for lacking approval from the correct authority under Section 151 after three years. The Tribunal held that sanction by an incorrect authority vitiates jurisdiction, rendering the reassessment void. The post Reassessment Quashed for Invalid Sanction u/s 151: Approval by PCIT Instead of PCCIT Held Void appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Oppression and Mismanagement in Companies
articles.summary: This analysis explains how majority control can oppress minority shareholders and how mismanagement harms companies. The key takeaway is that law intervenes only when conduct is unfair, continuous, and prejudicial. The post Oppression and Mismanagement in Companies appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: GST Not Payable on Statutory Fees Collected by Electricity Regulators: P&H HC
articles.summary: The Court held that petition, ARR processing, and licence fees collected while performing statutory regulatory functions do not constitute taxable supply under GST, leading to quashing of the show cause notice. The post GST Not Payable on Statutory Fees Collected by Electricity Regulators: P H HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Corporate Guarantee to Subsidiary Under GST Lens: Bombay HC to Decide
articles.summary: The Court will examine whether corporate guarantees issued by a parent company to its subsidiaries amount to a taxable supply under GST, while granting interim protection against coercive action. The post Corporate Guarantee to Subsidiary Under GST Lens: Bombay HC to Decide appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Change of SFIO Probe is Procedural, Not Review: NCLAT Chennai
articles.summary: The appellate tribunal held that substituting the investigating agency did not amount to a review or recall. Since the original investigation order remained intact, the appeal was dismissed. The post Change of SFIO Probe is Procedural, Not Review: NCLAT Chennai appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: GST Order Cannot Go Beyond SCN; Statutory Breach Not Technical: Calcutta HC
articles.summary: The High Court held that a GST adjudication order cannot be based on grounds not mentioned in the show cause notice. Both adjudication and appellate orders were set aside for violating Section 75(7). The post GST Order Cannot Go Beyond SCN; Statutory Breach Not Technical: Calcutta HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Income Tax Recovery Without Supplying Assessment Order Copy Invalid: Delhi HC
articles.summary: The Court ruled that recovery of tax without supplying the assessment order lacks authority of law. Refund with interest was directed unless the order is traced and served by a specified date. The post Income Tax Recovery Without Supplying Assessment Order Copy Invalid: Delhi HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 87A Rebate Cannot Be Denied for STCG and LTCG: ITAT Indore
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that Section 87A rebate applies to STCG and LTCG taxed under Sections 111A and 112 when income is within ₹7 lakh. The denial based on system logic and future amendments was rejected. The post Section 87A Rebate Cannot Be Denied for STCG and LTCG: ITAT Indore appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Plaint Rejected: NCLT, Not Civil Court, Has Jurisdiction over Debt & Fraud: Delhi HC
articles.summary: Delhi High Court held that issues relating to debt and fraud is within the jurisdiction of NCLT to be determined in accordance with IBC. Resultantly, the power of a civil court to entertain the present suit is, therefore, statutorily barred. Accordingly, the plaint is rejected. The post Plaint Rejected: NCLT, Not Civil Court, Has Jurisdiction over Debt   Fraud: Delhi HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: NCLT Cannot Decide Trademark Title Disputes Dehors Insolvency Process: SC
articles.summary: The issue was whether the NCLT could declare ownership of a trademark during CIRP. The Supreme Court held that title disputes not arising directly from insolvency fall outside Section 60(5) jurisdiction. The post NCLT Cannot Decide Trademark Title Disputes Dehors Insolvency Process: SC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Auditing in Dubai’s Gems & Jewellery Industry: Key Challenges with their Solutions
articles.summary: The article explains how evolving regulations and global reporting standards affect jewellery audits. It concludes that continuous professional training and auditor–management coordination are vital. The post Auditing in Dubai’s Gems   Jewellery Industry: Key Challenges with their Solutions appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Turnover Suppression Found, But Only Profit Element Taxable: ITAT Patna
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that while fee suppression was established during survey proceedings, the entire difference could not be taxed. Only the gross profit on suppressed receipts, excluding GST, is chargeable to tax. The post Turnover Suppression Found, But Only Profit Element Taxable: ITAT Patna appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: No Adverse Inference Allowed Without Rejecting Books or Stock Records
articles.summary: The decision reiterates that when books of account, sales, and inventory are accepted, purchase disallowances cannot be made mechanically. Suspicion cannot replace proof in tax proceedings. The post No Adverse Inference Allowed Without Rejecting Books or Stock Records appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 143(3) Order Invalid as Assessment Had Abated on Search Date
articles.summary: The Tribunal ruled that completion of assessment after search, despite statutory abatement, is impermissible. Jurisdiction shifts exclusively to Section 153A proceedings. The post Section 143(3) Order Invalid as Assessment Had Abated on Search Date appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Corpus Fund Withdrawal Not Taxable When Used for Charitable Objects: ITAT Chennai
articles.summary: The issue was whether utilisation of corpus donations for expenditure converts them into taxable income. The Tribunal held that corpus retains its exempt character when used as per donor directions and trust deed. The post Corpus Fund Withdrawal Not Taxable When Used for Charitable Objects: ITAT Chennai appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Penalty Imposed for Failure to Spend and Transfer CSR Amount
articles.summary: The adjudicating authority penalised a company for not spending mandatory CSR funds and failing to transfer unspent amounts on time. Subsequent rectification did not erase liability for the original default. The post Penalty Imposed for Failure to Spend and Transfer CSR Amount appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Lesser Penalty Imposed for Incorrect Registered Office Filing by Startup
articles.summary: A company was penalised for filing an incomplete and incorrect INC-22 for change of registered office. Startup status helped secure a reduced penalty under Section 446B. The post Lesser Penalty Imposed for Incorrect Registered Office Filing by Startup appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Beyond 3 Years Upheld as Escapement Exceeded ₹50 Lakh — Cash Deposits u/s 69A
articles.summary: The issue was whether reassessment after three years was barred by limitation. The Tribunal held it valid since the escaped income exceeded ₹50 lakh, attracting the extended reopening window. The post Reassessment Beyond 3 Years Upheld as Escapement Exceeded ₹50 Lakh — Cash Deposits u/s 69A appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 270A Penalty Deleted for Suo Motu Withdrawal of Education Cess Claim
articles.summary: The tribunal held that penalty under Section 270A cannot be levied where the assessee voluntarily withdrew the education cess claim after a retrospective amendment. A bona fide claim made on prevailing judicial views does not amount to under-reporting or misreporting. The post Section 270A Penalty Deleted for Suo Motu Withdrawal of Education Cess Claim appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ROC imposes Penalty for Incorrect MGT-7A Filing Despite Timely Submission
articles.summary: Errors and omissions in the annual return were held to violate Section 92. Even timely filing does not cure defective disclosures, though penalties were reduced for a startup. The post ROC imposes Penalty for Incorrect MGT-7A Filing Despite Timely Submission appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Penalty Imposed for Using Private Placement Funds Before Statutory Filing
articles.summary: The adjudicating authority held that utilisation of application money before filing PAS-3 violates Section 42. Even procedural deviations in private placement can trigger substantial penalties. The post Penalty Imposed for Using Private Placement Funds Before Statutory Filing appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Penalty Imposed for Missing Disclosures in Preferential Allotment Filing
articles.summary: Failure to attach the EGM notice and explanatory statement in statutory filings was held to violate Rule 13(d). The key takeaway is that procedural lapses attract penalties even where shareholder approval exists. The post Penalty Imposed for Missing Disclosures in Preferential Allotment Filing appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Penalty u/s 271(1)(c) Not Sustainable on Estimated/40(a)(ia)/41(1) Additions: ITAT Agra
articles.summary: The case examined penalty levied on estimated additions and statutory disallowance. The Tribunal held that neither category amounts to concealment or inaccurate particulars. The new scheme may support larger chip design projects and retain strategic intellectual property in India. However, final details and approval are still pending.

articles.title: China, Hong Kong hold India’s chip supply reins
articles.summary: China remains India’s top chip supplier, accounting for nearly 30% of integrated circuits and micro assembly shipment worth $5.78 billion in April–November FY26, while Hong Kong contributed 18.5%. US shipments surged, but Taiwan’s supply fell. Overall, India sourced chips from 64 countries, slightly down from last year.

articles.title: Autodesk cuts 7% of workforce to redirect investments to AI, cloud

articles.title: Uber to double its premium service Uber Black fleet this year

The company has backed fleet manager Carrum to support this expansion across key cities. Uber has also introduced advance booking for Uber Black rides in Delhi.

articles.title: Omnichannel jewellery retailer Bluestone turns profitable as Q3 revenue hits Rs 748 crore
articles.summary: Bluestone posted an operating revenue of Rs 748.6 crore in Q3, up 27.5% year-on-year (YoY) from Rs 587 crore from the year prior. The company’s expenses rose marginally by 9% to Rs 688.9 crore in the December quarter from Rs 629.8 crore a year ago. However, the company’s revenues rose faster, by 27.5%, leading to its first-ever profit.

articles.title: IPO-bound PhonePe cofounders sold stake worth $430 million to General Atlantic in 2025
articles.summary: PhonePe cofounders Sameer Nigam and Rahul Chari sold shares worth Rs 3,937 crore ($430 million) to US private equity firm General Atlantic ahead of the company’s IPO. The IPO, entirely an offer for sale, will allow partial exits for Walmart and full exits for Microsoft and Tiger Global. PhonePe is expected to be valued at around $15 billion.

articles.title: Alibaba to plan IPO for AI chipmaking unit T-Head: Report
articles.summary: Alibaba's US-listed shares rose 4.6% ‌premarket after ‌the report. As a first step, Alibaba plans to restructure ‌the unit as a business partly owned by employees before exploring an initial public offering, though the timing remains unclear, the report said.

articles.title: Apple asks court to halt Indian antitrust inquiry into App Store policies

articles.title: Elevation Capital's Mayank Khanduja exits VC firm after 15-year stint
articles.summary: Mayank Khanduja has left Elevation Capital as partner, ending a career there that began in 2011. He backed startups including ShareChat and NoBroker, and his move follows the earlier exit of partner Vivek Mathur. The departure reflects a shift as venture capitalists leave large funds to launch their own firms.

Hala Mobility received the funding after making a pitch on entrepreneurial reality show Bharat Ke Super Founders, streamed on Amazon MX Player.

articles.title: Everything you wanted to know about Albinder Dhindsa, the man behind Blinkit and the next Eternal CEO
articles.summary: Dhindsa’s history with Zomato goes way back. In 2011, he joined the startup as head of international operations, working closely with Goyal to expand the platform into international markets such as the UK, the UAE, and New Zealand.

articles.title: Budget wishlist: Nasscom calls for cloud tax clarity, Esop tax deferment for more startups
articles.summary: The association - whose members include IT companies and tech players across-the-spectrum, of varying size and scale - wants the Budget to clarify that procuring hosting or co-location services from an Indian data centre operator would not create a business connection or permanent establishment for the foreign cloud service provider, as the arm's length payments to the Indian player fully cover India-based functions.

articles.title: IPO-bound PhonePe H1 revenue rises 22%, but losses expand; eyes April listing

Revenue from the payments business, including consumer and merchant payments, grew 15% to Rs 3,405 crore during the period, compared with Rs 2,961 crore in the corresponding period last year.

articles.title: Eternal shares jump 7% on Q3 beat, leadership shift. What should investors do?

The company announced founder Deepinder Goyal will transition to Vice Chairman, with Blinkit CEO Albinder Singh Dhindsa appointed as the new CEO. Analysts maintain Buy ratings, citing growth momentum and margin expansion.

articles.title: Crypto firm BitGo raises $212.8 million in US IPO

articles.title: PhonePe IPO: Walmart to cut 9% stake, Microsoft, Tiger Global to exit

This move will see a partial exit for major backer Walmart and a full sell-down by early investors Microsoft and Tiger Global. The company has received in-principle approval to list on the BSE and NSE.
