articles.title: Court rules TikTok can continue to operate in Canada for now
articles.summary: In November 2024, ‌Canada's industry ‌ministry ordered TikTok's business to be dissolved, citing national security risks, but added ‌the government was not blocking access or users' ability to create content.

articles.title: Surging memory chip prices dim outlook for consumer electronics makers
articles.summary: The rapid build-out of artificial intelligence infrastructure by U.S. tech firms such as OpenAI, Alphabet-owned Google and Microsoft has absorbed much of the world's memory chip supply, pushing up prices as manufacturers prioritize components for higher-margin data centers over consumer devices.

articles.title: PSU banks counting on QR-based payments to breach a fintech fort
articles.summary: Public sector banks are entering QR-code merchant payments, challenging fintechs like Paytm and PhonePe. These lenders are not only trying to build servicing channels for these merchants, they are also looking to build merchant-focused applications, soundboxes and QR code-led acquisition strategies.

articles.title: PE-backed digital engineering services firms turn to M&A deals in search for scale
articles.summary: With a receptive market for IPOs and a significant expansion of the market for digital engineering services—beyond traditional software development to encompass cloud-native product engineering, software modernisation and embedded AI solutions, among others—PE-led firms are using inorganic growth routes to propel their growth and cash in on faster exit opportunities.

articles.title: Bharti eyes Karnataka data centre; Sify set to inaugurate new facility
articles.summary: Bharti Enterprises has expressed interest in setting up a data centre in Karnataka, industries minister M B Patil said on Wednesday. Patil made the announcement while attending the world economic forum in Davos.

articles.title: We don’t give investment advice, says Sudha Murty, urging people to stay vigilant against cyber crime
articles.summary: In a post on X, Murty said, “I want to alert you to fake videos circulating online that falsely use my image and voice to promote financial schemes and investments. These are deepfakes created without my knowledge or consent. Please do not make any financial decisions based on these fraudulent videos. "

articles.title: Pocket FM taps former Meta scientist Vasu Sharma as head of AI
articles.summary: Pocket FM has appointed Vasu Sharma, a former scientist at Meta’s Facebook AI Research (FAIR), as its head of artificial intelligence (AI). Sharma, who will report to cofounder Prateek Dixit, will lead AI research and innovation across narrative generation, production intelligence and large-scale localisation.

articles.title: Ryanair CEO dismisses Elon Musk's idea of buying the airline as verbal feud escalates
articles.summary: The CEO of Ryanair on Wednesday dismissed Elon Musk's idea of buying the budget airline and shrugged off insults from the billionaire, in a war of words that erupted over installing Starlink systems on aircraft. O'Leary said last week that the airline had ruled out putting Musk's Starlink satellite Wi-Fi on Ryanair planes because the extra fuel drag from the system's antennas would be too costly.

articles.title: Nvidia boss sees 'trillions' in AI spending ahead
articles.summary: The infrastructure to develop and power generative artificial intelligence models will require further "trillions" of dollars in investment, the head of top AI chipmaker Nvidia said Wednesday.

articles.title: US-based Blaize signs MoU with Telangana govt to support AI initiatives
articles.summary: Blaize signed an MoU with the Telangana government to support initiatives in electronics, semiconductors, and AI. The partnership will explore industry use-cases for AI solutions in healthcare diagnostics, manufacturing automation, and energy efficiency. The company has raised over $330 million from global investors including Mercedes-Benz and Samsung.

articles.title: Blinkit turns Ebitda positive in Q3FY26
articles.summary: Quick commerce platform Blinkit turned adjusted EBITDA positive for the first time in Q3 FY26, posting a Rs 4 crore profit compared with a Rs 103 crore loss a year earlier. This comes just as Deepinder Goyal stepped down as Eternal CEO, with Albinder Dhindsa appointed his successor.

articles.title: Amagi’s muted listing cuts valuation 41% to $821 million
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs made a muted stock market debut, with its market capitalisation falling over 41% from its last private valuation. The SaaS company raised Rs 1,789 crore through its IPO, which was subscribed 30 times despite global market concerns. Early backers and founders of Amagi Media Labs saw a modest dip in paper gains following the listing.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Structured dispute resolution tops tax reform wishlist
articles.summary: Businesses are urging the government to prioritise tax reforms in the upcoming budget. Key demands include quicker resolution of tax disputes and improved certainty in transfer pricing. Streamlining customs procedures and liberalising schemes like MOOWR are also crucial.

articles.title: Over 10,000 km of roads sanctioned under Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana-IV: Govt
articles.summary: Over 10,000 km of road projects have been sanctioned for six states under PMGSY-IV, promising connectivity to 3,270 isolated habitations. This initiative aims to unlock opportunities, foster inclusive growth, and solidify the foundation for a developed India by bridging gaps in healthcare, education, and livelihoods.

articles.title: Exporters’ budget wishlist: tax sops, inverted duty structure correction, and more
articles.summary: Exporters are urging the government to implement tax incentives and rationalize import duties in the upcoming Budget. Key demands include reduced income tax for MSMEs, reinstatement of customs duty exemptions on certain leathers, and correction of inverted duty structures in sectors like synthetic yarns and electronics to boost domestic manufacturing and export competitiveness.

articles.title: Why this PE guru says India could be No. 1 in your lifetime
articles.summary: David Rubenstein of The Carlyle Group predicts India could become the world's largest economy within 20-30 years, citing its young, growing population as a key advantage over aging nations. While India's economy is already the fourth largest, sustained growth and strategic reforms are crucial to capitalize on this demographic dividend and achieve global economic dominance.

articles.title: Budget 2026: India's top audit body has suggested Nirmala Sitharaman to change tax process for husband, wife
articles.summary: Income tax news: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India has proposed optional joint taxation for married couples in its pre-budget suggestions for 2026. This move could simplify tax compliance and potentially reduce the tax burden for many households, especially single-earner families, by allowing them to file a single return.

articles.title: ET Budget 2026 Survey: No easy choices for India this year as policy space shrinks dramatically in tariffs' wake
articles.summary: Budget 2026 Expectations Survey: With February 1 on the horizon, India finds itself grappling with uncertain global trade dynamics and various domestic challenges. ET's pre-budget survey indicates that citizens are overwhelmingly in favour of promoting local manufacturing and increasing exports. Additionally, many are advocating for income tax cuts.

articles.title: After capacity creation, manufacturing looks to Budget 2026 for the next push
articles.summary: Union Budget: India’s manufacturing sector has moved from policy intent to capacity creation, with investment gaining pace across industries. As the Union Budget nears, stakeholders are looking for system-level reforms that improve competitiveness, remove bottlenecks and support innovation and scale in the next phase of growth.

articles.title: New year, new challenges & a retest of macro resilience set the backdrop to Budget 2026
articles.summary: Union Budget: After a volatile 2025 marked by geopolitical tensions, trade disruptions and capital flow shifts, the economy is looking to the upcoming budget to support growth, maintain fiscal discipline and shield against external shocks. While goods exports slowed and the rupee weakened amid global churn and US tariff pressures, service exports, softer crude prices, easing food inflation and policy support helped the domestic economy stay resilient.

articles.title: India likely to grow 6.5-7% in FY27 amid global risks: ET-PwC survey
articles.summary: As per the survey, 78% of respondents expect India's growth to remain in the 6.5-7% band in FY27, reflecting optimism arising out of the current growth momentum, which the majority of CXOs described as strong to stable, while 21% expect it to be between 6% and 6.5%, and only 1% of the respondents foresee it in the 7-7.5% range.

articles.title: New labour codes weigh on BFSI sector's earnings
articles.summary: New labour laws in India have increased costs for banks, NBFCs, and insurance firms. Companies adjusted staff benefits to comply with these reforms. HDFC Bank reported an expense impact of about Rs 800 crore. Other lenders like ICICI Bank and Yes Bank also saw significant impacts.

articles.title: India to remain fastest-growing major economy despite global tensions: RBI
articles.summary: India's economy is poised for strong growth, projected to be the world's fastest. Domestic demand is robust, and the manufacturing and services sectors are performing well. Despite global geopolitical risks and US trade tariffs, Indian exporters are diversifying.

articles.title: A guide to PMAY-Urban 2.0: Affordable housing for urban India
articles.summary: Dream of owning a home? Discover PMAY-Urban 2.0 benefits, including interest subsidies and financial aid for urban housing. Check your eligibility and apply today!

articles.title: Tariffs be damned: Global CEOs are still betting on India
articles.summary: Global CEOs see India as a top investment spot for 2026. Strong economic growth, a large consumer base, and stable policies are key attractions. India's economy is expanding rapidly, outpacing many nations. Reforms in taxation and labor laws further boost confidence. This makes India a resilient and attractive destination for international capital amid global slowdowns.

articles.title: Realty weakness overdone, midcap correction throws up long-term opportunities: Sandip Sabharwal
articles.summary: Market expert Sandip Sabharwal suggests real estate stock pessimism may be misplaced due to accounting practices, highlighting DLF, Godrej Properties, and Prestige as selective buying opportunities. He also sees potential in large banks and select NBFCs, with midcaps and smallcaps offering the best risk-reward over two years.

articles.title: IndiGrid raises Rs 1,500 cr through institutional placement
articles.summary: IndiGrid Infrastructure Trust successfully raised Rs 1,500 crore via an oversubscribed institutional placement, attracting significant participation from insurance and mutual funds. This capital infusion, alongside a prior preferential issue, brings their total FY26 equity fundraising to Rs 1,938 crore. The move bolsters their balance sheet, enabling disciplined growth and enhancing unitholder value.

articles.title: DLF pre-sales down 16 pc in Apr-Dec to Rs 16,176 cr
articles.summary: DLF Ltd's sales bookings declined 16 percent to Rs 16,176 crore in the first nine months of this fiscal year. This decrease was due to reduced new home supply. The company remains confident in achieving its annual sales target of Rs 20,000-22,000 crore. DLF reported a 14 percent increase in net profit for the December quarter.

articles.title: What Ashish Kacholia, Mukul Agrawal, Vijay Kedia, Dolly Khanna bought and sold in Q3
articles.summary: Veteran investors Ashish Kacholia, Mukul Agrawal, Vijay Kedia and Dolly Khanna remained active in Q3 FY26, selectively adding new stocks, raising stakes and trimming exposure amid a sharp selloff in smallcap equities.

articles.title: Fed signals pause as policymakers split on inflation and jobs
articles.summary: US Federal Reserve officials are pausing interest rate cuts. Policymakers are divided on future action. Some fear inflation will rise again. Others worry the job market will weaken without more cuts. The Fed is balancing inflation control with economic growth. Future decisions will depend on incoming economic data.

articles.title: Sensex and Nifty edge modestly higher on easing geopolitical jitters
articles.summary: Indian equities opened marginally higher on Friday, extending a modest recovery after a three-session decline. Gains in Asian markets and easing geopolitical tensions provided some support, but persistent foreign fund outflows and mixed corporate results maintained investor caution.

articles.title: Giva’s funding glitter; PhonePe cofounders sell big stake
articles.summary: Happy Friday! Giva is set to close a fresh funding round amid rising D2C jewellery interest. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

articles.title: Mphasis Q3 profit up 3.5% YoY to Rs 442 crore
articles.summary: Indian mid-tier IT firms showed mixed performance in Q3 FY26, affected by seasonal softness and labour code changes. Mphasis posted a 3.3% YoY profit rise to Rs 442 crore, while Cyient’s profit fell 25% to Rs 91.8 crore. AI-led deals and BFSI growth helped offset some challenges across the sector.

articles.title: The AI startup soap opera riveting Silicon Valley
articles.summary: Thinking Machines, the AI startup cofounded by former OpenAI CTO Mira Murati, has faced internal turmoil as top executives Zoph, Metz and Schoenholz left for OpenAI amid disagreements over strategy and funding. Meta also apparently lured some other staff with offers worth hundreds of millions of dollars. The startup, valued at $12 billion, continues independently under Murati.

articles.title: Rwanda to test AI-powered technology in clinics under a new Gates Foundation project
articles.summary: Rwanda will test technology powered by artificial intelligence in more than 50 health clinics as part of a new initiative by the Gates Foundation to support 1,000 clinics across Africa with the aim to improve health care services.

articles.title: Karnataka approves AI centre of excellence to drive deeptech innovation in Bengaluru
articles.summary: Karnataka has cleared the launch of a new artificial intelligence centre in Bengaluru to boost AI use and deeptech innovation. The facility, set up with NASSCOM, will support startups, MSMEs and research institutions across key technology areas. The Rs 20-crore project aims to strengthen the state’s position as a hub for applied AI.

articles.title: Infosys asks employees to share WFH electricity data as it chases tall carbon goals
articles.summary: As the IT service giant’s employees spend most of their time working from home under its hybrid policy, Infosys is mapping its power usage to update its emissions reporting. The data will help the company design sustainability initiatives and offset its footprint with higher renewable energy output.

articles.title: Spotify launches AI-driven 'prompted playlist' for premium users in US, Canada
articles.summary: Spotify has launched a new artificial intelligence feature called 'prompted playlist' in the United States and Canada. This tool allows premium subscribers to create personalised music lists using their listening history and specific commands. The feature aims to give users more control over their music experience.

articles.title: IIT Bombay's new smart platform to help researchers decode brain diseases
articles.summary: IIT Bombay bioengineers have created new smart platforms. BrainProt unifies brain disease data from genes to proteins. DrugProtAI predicts if proteins can be drug targets. These tools help researchers find disease markers.

articles.title: Musk's chatbot flooded X with millions of sexualised images in days, new estimates show
articles.summary: Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, created and shared over 1.8 million sexualized images of women and children. This surge of disturbing content, generated in just nine days, sparked global outrage and investigations by governments. The scale and public nature of these AI-generated images surpassed previous online collections. X has since implemented restrictions on Grok's image creation capabilities.

articles.title: Mphasis meets third-quarter revenue estimates as banks resume tech spending
articles.summary: Indian information technology company Mphasis reported third-quarter ‍revenue in line with ​estimates on Thursday, with banking and financial ⁠services clients resuming spending on technology amid better macroeconomic and policy clarity.

articles.title: Hey RBI, leave the PEs alone
articles.summary: Since late 2024, RBI has been frowning at investors having control of multiple lenders. PE firms that have held 20% or more in non-bank lenders have previously had to divest holdings. Imposing such ‘non-compete’ clauses for PEs may even be perceived as a regulatory overreach. It is likely to impact credit growth among those who remain unbanked, reduce exit optionality and squeeze out critical FDI equity inflows

articles.title: Blue Machines AI sets new benchmark by engaging in unscripted hour-long debate on national TV
articles.summary: In a groundbreaking national television debut, Indian AI platform Blue Machines AI successfully engaged in a 60-minute unscripted news debate. This historic man-versus-machine contest showcased the AI's ability to handle complex discussions, interruptions, and rapid topic shifts, demonstrating enterprise-grade reliability and governance for India's burgeoning tech sector.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: The unnatural beauty of Dhurandhar: Why Aditya Dhar's polarising film works as pure cinema
articles.summary: A visually arresting, fiercely polarising action thriller, Dhurandhar transcends propaganda debates through raw performances, brutal choreography, and an uncanny portrayal of familiar worlds rendered disturbingly strange.

articles.title: Where this top Fidelity bond manager is investing for 2026
articles.summary: Celso Muñoz is among what Morningstar calls the "best-in-class" bond fund managers at Fidelity. Here is where he sees opportunity for income-oriented investors.

articles.title: Coforge to fund Encora acquisition via bank loan, rules out QIP
articles.summary: Coforge CEO Sudhir Singh said BFSI growth is expected to recover from quarter four and could become the fastest-growing vertical in 2026-27 FY27), supported by large deal wins. Singh said 2026-27 is likely to be a strong year for growth, aided by the Encora acquisition and expansion in healthcare, high tech and public sector segments. He added that margins should improve in 2026-27 over 2025-26 (FY26), with 14% remaining the floor, while key client relationships such as Sabre remain stable and o

articles.title: Siddhartha Khemka remains positive on banks, upgrades Bandhan Bank to buy
articles.summary: Siddhartha Khemka of Motilal Oswal Financial Services maintains a neutral stance on United Spirits and prefers Radico Khaitan within the alco-beverages space, where growth and margin trends are stronger.

articles.title: Foreign investor backing Swiggy and Ixigo wants to put more money into India
articles.summary: Prosus plans to scale its India exposure to $50 billion, bets big on AI labs and expects more IPOs as portfolio companies move towards profitability.

articles.title: 3BHK affordability slips further as housing prices outpace income growth across India’s mega markets
articles.summary: Square Yards reports 3BHK homes in India’s top metros now cost ₹2.7 crore, making them unaffordable for most, with supply skewed toward premium buyers and investor-driven markets.

articles.title: RBI’s dollar sales cross FY25 levels, hit $43.2 billion as rupee stays volatile
articles.summary: While spot market sales slowed in November, RBI’s forward market positions stayed elevated. The central bank had sold $66 billion in forwards by the end of the month.

articles.title: What should Budget 2026 focus on, a new survey
articles.summary: The Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI) conducted a survey of 100 companies to list out the industry's expectation from India's annual budget to be tabled in the Parliament on Feb 1.

articles.title: Dipan Mehta on when to buy midcaps and sectors where value is emerging
articles.summary: Dipan Mehta, Director of Elixir Equities said Sky Gold and Diamonds offers exposure to the jewellery sector through its B2B model. As a key supplier to major jewellery chains, the company stands out for its strong growth prospects and reasonable valuations, making it a stock to watch.

articles.title: South Korea's economy shrinks; net exports and domestic housing demand in focus
articles.summary: Housing continues to be a major fault line at home. According to the Korea Real Estate Board, flat prices in Seoul continued to rise for the 50th week in a row as of January 12, rejecting repeated attempts by the government to temper the market.

articles.title: India to sift through urban waste for critical minerals, may tweak e-waste rules
articles.summary: Mines Secretary Piyush Goyal expects India to become a regional recycling hub for critical minerals, with new schemes and private sector partnerships boosting recovery and value chain development.

articles.title: Rupee could slide to 92.5-93 per dollar if pressure persists: ANZ’s Dhiraj Nim
articles.summary: Dhiraj Nim, Economist and FX Strategist at ANZ Research, attributed the rupee’s weakness to two key pressures: continued outflows from Indian markets amid visible stress from the ongoing earnings season and global risk jitters.

articles.title: Bihar govt awards ₹100-crore Aadhar enrolment centres project to BLS
articles.summary: The Bihar government on Tuesday awarded a project worth Rs 100 crore to an AI and techenabled company for establishing Permanent Enrollment Centres (PEC) for Aadhaar, a company official said.

articles.title: What India Inc wants from Budget 2026: Cost relief, faster execution, policy clarity
articles.summary: Ahead of Budget 2026, leaders like Nirmala Sitharaman, Aparna Reddy, Abhimanyu Munjal and Prashant Mathur urge targeted fiscal support, faster execution and cost rationalisation for growth.

articles.title: India’s core sector growth hits four-month high in December, led by cement and steel
articles.summary: Eight core industries grew 3.7% in December, up from 2.1% in November, with cement and steel output rising sharply. Crude oil and natural gas production continued to decline.

articles.title: Andhra Pradesh is open for business: ‘Just one whatsapp message away’, says Nara Lokesh at WEF
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh IT and HRD Minister Nara Lokesh said that "good news" around investments across 22 various clusters ranging from aqua, cement, renewable energy, and quantum, among other sectors can be expected in the next 90 days. Read on:

articles.title: Budget 2026 needs to be more than Aatmanirbhar
articles.summary: In a world where leverage beats values-based alliances, strategic autonomy is a necessity both for economic growth and diplomatic success. Therefore, the next budget must be anchored in foreign policy as much as local economic needs.

articles.title: FMCG demand stabilises after GST reset, but recovery remains uneven
articles.summary: Industry data shows FMCG growth has sustained in recent months but is now driven mainly by volumes after the GST reset and lower prices. Value growth remains softer, while competition among online and offline retail channels is increasing.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Axis Bank CEO flags deposit stress amid faster credit growth, seeks RBI liquidity push
articles.summary: Axis Bank CEO Amitabh Chaudhry warned of intense competition for deposits, urged stronger RBI liquidity support, and said credit and deposit growth cannot diverge, speaking at Davos.

articles.title: After historic profit, government moves to strengthen discoms
articles.summary: After historic profit, the Centre forms a GoM to strengthen discom finances, address state liabilities, and continue reforms that have cut losses and improved efficiency.

articles.title: Global growth to hold steady at 3.3% in 2026, says IMF; India seen growing at 6.4% in FY27
articles.summary: India’s growth outlook remains one of the strongest, with expansion projected at 6.4% in both FY27 and FY28, after an upward revision to 7.3% for FY26 on the back of a stronger-than-expected outturn. India's growth projections are 6.3% for 2026 and 6.5% for 2027 based on calendar year, the IMF said in its report.

articles.title: Explainer: Understanding market borrowing and fiscal deficit, the numbers that move markets on Budget day
articles.summary: On Budget day, markets focus on gross borrowing and fiscal deficit figures, as these impact bond yields, RBI actions, and equity valuations in banks, NBFCs, real estate and infrastructure.

articles.title: Tanla Platforms Q3 Results: Net profit up 11% on strong revenue growth across segments
articles.summary: Tanla Platforms reported Q3 net profit of ₹131.3 crore, up 10.8% YoY, on revenue of ₹1,121 crore, up 12.1% YoY. EBITDA rose 16.9% to ₹190.5 crore with a 17% margin, while gross profit reached ₹309 crore and gross margin was 27.6%. EPS stood at ₹9.95 and free cash flow was ₹137 crore, 104% of PAT.

articles.title: Young Turks Reloaded | India’s IPO boom is just getting started, says Lightspeed as startup bets shift to 2026
articles.summary: Lightspeed’s leadership breaks down why India’s startup ecosystem is entering a structurally stronger phase — from sustained IPO depth and domestic capital support to AI-led enterprise transformation and the growing influence of a young, tech-native workforce shaping the next wave of founders.

articles.title: Davos 2026: McKinsey flags radical uncertainty, urges CEOs to make bold moves amid geopolitical shifts
articles.summary: According to McKinsey leaders Gautam Kumra and Alex Panas, the scale and complexity of today’s global disruptions mean traditional scenario planning is no longer sufficient.

articles.title: Paramount extends its deadline for its Warner Bros. tender offer, again
articles.summary: Skydanceowned Paramount is again extending the tender offer window in its $77.9 billion hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, while doubling down on a coming proxy fight.

articles.title: HUDCO board to consider raising FY26 borrowing plan to ₹80,000 crore on January 29
articles.summary: HUDCO's board will meet on January 29 to consider increasing its FY26 annual borrowing plan to ₹80,000 crore from ₹65,000 crore, review Q3 and nine-month financial results, and decide on a third interim dividend, with February 7 set as the record date subject to approval.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | AI beats humans at keeping customers happy, says Freshworks CEO
articles.summary: Freshworks is using AI agents to revolutionise customer support and internal workflows. CEO Dennis Woodside said AI now handles half of incoming queries, boosting efficiency and satisfaction while freeing humans for complex tasks. The company is also targeting larger enterprises, leveraging fast-to-deploy, easy-to-use AI solutions to compete with big players like Salesforce.

articles.title: Batteries central to Waaree Energies' plans; 20 GW manufacturing plant coming up: Abhishek Pareek
articles.summary: Waaree Group Head Finance Abhishek Pareek details non-China polysilicon sourcing, phased 20 GW battery rollout and integrated capacity expansion during post-results interaction

articles.title: IndiGo hit harder by labour codes than December flight disruptions
articles.summary: InterGlobe Aviation Ltd (IndiGo) reported a 78% YoY decline in Q3 net profit to ₹550 crore, despite a 6.2% rise in revenue to ₹23,472 crore. The sharp fall was primarily driven by an exceptional charge of ₹1,547 crore, of which ₹969 crore was linked to the implementation of the new labour codes, exceeding the ₹577 crore cost from operational disruptions.

articles.title: Syngene International Q3 Results: Net profit dives 89% on large-molecule biologics impact
articles.summary: Syngene International reported a net profit of ₹15 crore for Q3 FY26, down 88.5% YoY from ₹131 crore. Revenue declined 2.8% to ₹917 crore, while EBITDA fell 25.9% to ₹209.2 crore, leading to a margin contraction to 22.8% from 30% YoY.

articles.title: US applications for jobless benefits inch up last week to a still-low 200,000
articles.summary: Applications for unemployment benefits are viewed as a proxy for layoffs and are close to a real-time indicator of the health of the job market.

articles.title: Suryoday SFB Q3 Results: Net profit up 10% on higher NII, asset quality slips
articles.summary: Suryoday Small Finance Bank reported a net profit of ₹36.5 crore in Q3FY26, up 9.6% YoY from ₹33.3 crore. Net interest income rose 3.2% to ₹276.8 crore. Asset quality pressures were seen with gross NPA at 4.35% and net NPA at 6.69%, up from 3.80% and 5.93% respectively in Q2FY26.

articles.title: Adani Total Gas Q3: Profit dips 3% QoQ; revenue inches up, margins flat
articles.summary: Adani Total Gas Q3 revenue and EBITDA rose modestly, net profit slipped 3.3% over the previous quarter. Labour codes impact recognised with ₹7.2-crore exceptional costs. Shares of Adani Total Gas ended higher on Thursday, January 22, by 4.33% at ₹551.

articles.title: ONGC acquires 50% in two JVs with Mitsui OSK for ₹40 cr to expedite ethane transport
articles.summary: ONGC invests ₹40 crore for 50% stake in two JVs with Mitsui O.S.K. Lines Ltd to boost ethane transport for OPaL, with VLECs registered at GIFT City, Gandhinagar. DIPAM approvals obtained.

articles.title: Ashoka Buildcon wins ₹308 crore contract to build signature bridge in Daman
articles.summary: Ashoka Buildcon has received a Letter of Acceptance from the Public Works Department, Work Division-I, Daman for the construction of a signature bridge connecting Jampore Sea Front road near the Light House to Devka Sea Front road at Parkota Sheri. The project, awarded at ₹307.71 crore excluding GST, is on a Design, Build, and Operate basis and is to be completed within 30 months.

articles.title: Davos deals | NTPC Green Energy signs MoU with Uttar Pradesh for renewable projects
articles.summary: The agreement was signed during World Economic Forum meet in Davos to develop clean energy initiatives across the state.

articles.title: Finnish lift major KONE bets on India's housing boom, unveils energy-efficient 'villa' elevator
articles.summary: The newly-launched KONE Villa 100's power consumption is lower than that of a household refrigerator, per the company. Speaking to CNBC-TV18, Amit Gossain said KONE India has seen sustained double-digit growth over the past four years, growth being led primarily by the residential segment, which accounts for about 60% of India's elevator market.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Maharashtra bets big on innovation to leapfrog to a trillion-dollar economy
articles.summary: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said Maharashtra’s push into AI, data centres and integrated innovation cities is aimed at creating a scalable ecosystem that can drive long-term growth, attract global capital and position the state ahead of the next investment cycle.

articles.title: Cyient Q3 Results: Net profit slides 28% QoQ; revenue, margins rise; AI focus to aid recovery
articles.summary: Cyient’s Q3 net profit fell 28% to ₹91.8 crore on the back of tariff hiccups, but revenue and EBIT margin grew. The company is boosting AI skills in India and expects recovery, says Krishna Bodanapu and Prabhakar Atla. Shares of Cyient ended higher by 1.41% at ₹1,139 on the NSE.

articles.title: Bandhan Bank Q3 Results: Net profit falls 52% on higher provisions, misses estimates
articles.summary: Bandhan Bank’s total business crossed ₹3 lakh crore in Q3 FY26, driven by steady growth in deposits and advances. The private lender reported a net profit of ₹206 crore for the quarter, up 84% sequentially from ₹112 crore in Q2 FY26, though down 51.6% YoY from ₹426 crore. Net revenue rose 7.8% QoQ to ₹3,379 crore, with net interest income at ₹2,689 crore and a NIM of 5.9%.

articles.title: Adani Energy Solutions Q3: Profit slips; revenue up 15%, smart meters near 1 crore by FY26-end
articles.summary: Adani Energy Solutions Q3 net profit dipped. Smart meter installs hit 92.5 lakh. Shares of Adani Energy Solutions ended higher on Thursday, January 22, by 3.02% at ₹926.50 on the NSE.

articles.title: IIFL Finance sinks 15% after tax audit order; founder calls it 'procedural'
articles.summary: The company said the tax authorities have directed it to conduct a special audit of its accounts for a specified block period under Section 142(2A) of the Income Tax Act, 1961, and have appointed a special auditor for the exercise.

articles.title: Razorpay POS gets RBI approval for offline payment aggregator licence
articles.summary: Razorpay POS got RBI's Payment Aggregator Physical licence, allowing authorised in-store payments and boosting its regulatory position.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Microfinance, NBFC leaders seek credit guarantee and faster recovery tools
articles.summary: NBFC and microfinance leaders urge Budget 2026 to boost liquidity, expand credit guarantees, lower SARFAESI threshold, and aid MSMEs and women.

articles.title: Lemonade slashes Tesla full self-driving insurance rates by 50%
articles.summary: Lemonade launches Autonomous Car insurance for Tesla with Full Self-Driving, cutting rates by 50% when FSD is active. Rollout starts in Arizona and Oregon, leveraging Tesla data for pricing.

articles.title: NITI Aayog suggests setting up of national agency to implement green transition for MSMEs
articles.summary: NITI Aayog recommends a national project management agency for MSMEs’ green energy transition, aiming for net zero by 2070, with sector-specific roadmaps for cement and aluminium industries.

articles.title: Senco Gold acquires 68% stake in August Jewellery for ₹68 crore

articles.summary: Aiming for Viksit Bharat, it targets significantly increased per capita electricity consumption by 2030 and 2047, with a focus on renewable energy, nuclear power, and financing needs.

articles.title: Draft National Electricity Policy bets on tech & skills to drive energy goals
articles.summary: The government will support acquiring or developing critical power sector technologies through FDI and partnerships, encouraging industry-academia collaboration. Utilities will adopt AI and smart grid tech, with a goal for indigenously developed SCADA systems by 2030.

articles.title: Indian refiners shift oil strategy; trim Russian buys and turn to Middle East
articles.summary: The shift away from Russia comes as Middle East producers, armed with higher output quotas from the OPEC, are keeping global markets well-supplied, softening the impact on prices.

articles.summary: The policy targets increased per capita consumption, grid resilience for renewables, and consumer-centric services. It also proposes reforms in transmission, cybersecurity, and advanced nuclear energy adoption.

articles.title: Makhana to microchips, Republic Day to showcase India's story of growth
articles.summary: Republic Day tableaux are taking shape at Delhi Cantonment, showcasing India's past, present, and aspirations, with a special focus on the 150th anniversary of Vande Mataram. Around 30 displays, featuring military might, cultural legacies, and technological advancements, will be presented on Kartavya Path by 2,500 artistes.

articles.title: Triple talaq-halala FIR puts focus on legal grey area
articles.summary: An FIR in UP details a woman's alleged gang-rape under the guise of 'halala' after an instant triple talaq. The law banning triple talaq has been invoked, alongside provisions for rape and other offenses. This case highlights the legal grey area surrounding halala, a practice not recognized by Indian statutory law.

articles.title: Patent rejected for MNC’s cancer drug, generics to follow
articles.summary: The Indian Patent Office has rejected AbbVie's patent application for its cancer drug Venetoclax, citing a lack of inventive step and no enhancement in therapeutic efficacy. This decision, if upheld, could allow for the entry of more affordable generic versions of the drug into the Indian market.

articles.title: HC: Apart from refunds, how will you compensate flyers?
articles.summary: Delhi High Court has asked IndiGo to explain how it will compensate passengers affected by mass flight cancellations last December. The court noted that refunds are not the same as compensation. IndiGo is offering Rs 10,000 vouchers to some passengers. The court wants a detailed affidavit on compensation plans. Authorities have taken steps to prevent future disruptions.

articles.title: Meitei visiting Kuki fiancee shot dead on camera
articles.summary: A Meitei man visiting his Kuki fiancée in Churachandpur was abducted and shot dead on camera, sparking protests and an NIA probe. Graphic footage of the killing circulated widely. The incident occurred amidst ongoing ethnic tensions between Meitei and Kuki-Zo communities in Manipur, highlighting the fragile peace in the region.

articles.title: India condemns SFJ vandalism in Zagreb
articles.summary: India has strongly condemned the vandalism of its embassy in Zagreb by the Sikhs for Justice group, which attempted to replace the Tricolour with a "Khalistan flag." New Delhi has officially raised the matter with Croatian authorities, demanding justice for the perpetrators and emphasizing the inviolability of diplomatic premises.

articles.title: Basant Panchami, Friday prayers in separate areas of MP's Bhojshala today: SC
articles.summary: The Supreme Court has expedited the Bhojshala Saraswati Temple cum Maulana Kamal Maula Mosque dispute. Both Hindu and Muslim communities can now offer prayers simultaneously in demarcated areas. The court has lifted its stay on the Madhya Pradesh High Court proceedings. The ASI report will be unsealed and shared with both sides.

articles.title: Sajjan Kumar acquitted in a 1984 riots case
articles.summary: A Delhi court acquitted former Congress MP Sajjan Kumar in a 1984 anti-Sikh riot case, citing insufficient evidence. The judge emphasized the need for proof beyond a reasonable doubt, noting a lack of reliable testimony placing Kumar at the scene or proving his instigation. Kumar remains incarcerated due to life sentences in other riot-related convictions.

articles.title: MHA notifies Census 2027 schedule, lists 33 questions
articles.summary: India's upcoming Census 2027 will collect detailed household information, including building materials, amenities like water and sanitation, and ownership status. For the first time since 1931, caste details will be gathered. The houselisting and housing phase runs April-September 2026, with population enumeration in February 2027.

articles.title: Engineer shoots wife accidentally; distressed by death, he kills self
articles.summary: Tragedy struck in Ahmedabad as Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil's nephew, Yashrajsinh Gohil, allegedly shot his wife Rajeshwari accidentally with a licensed revolver. Devastated by her death, he then reportedly took his own life. Police are investigating the incident, which occurred late Wednesday night in their apartment.

Bank depositors' role in funding credit growth on decline: RBI data
articles.summary: India's banks are seeing their deposit base struggle to keep up with surging commercial credit demand. While bank credit still dominates, its share in funding is shrinking as non-bank sources like NBFCs and bond markets gain prominence. This indicates a significant shift in how businesses are financed, with banks facing increasing pressure.

articles.title: US Regulator Seeks to Bypass Indian Govt to Serve Adani Summons
articles.summary: US regulators are seeking court permission to email summons directly to Indian billionaire Gautam Adani and an executive, after India twice refused to serve them. The SEC alleges fraud and a bribery scheme. Adani Group denies the claims, vowing to fight them. India cited procedural issues and questioned the SEC's authority for the rejections.

articles.title: IndiGo profit dives 78% in December quarter over flight disruptions
articles.summary: IndiGo's net profit plummeted 78% to Rs 549 crore in the December quarter, impacted by Rs 577 crore in operational disruptions and Rs 1,000 crore from labour code provisions. Despite flight cuts and fare caps, total income rose 6.7% to Rs 24,541 crore, with the airline carrying 12.4 crore passengers in 2025.

articles.title: General Atlantic bets on Balaji Wafers, to buy minority stake
articles.summary: US private equity firm General Atlantic is acquiring a minority stake in Indian snack food maker Balaji Wafers for over Rs 2,000 crore. This investment values the Rajkot-based company at approximately Rs 35,000 crore. The deal aims to support Balaji Wafers' expansion, innovation, and professional team development as it targets an IPO in five years.

articles.title: Walmart to cut 10 percent stake in PhonePe IPO
articles.summary: Fintech giant PhonePe is preparing for its stock market debut, aiming to raise Rs 12,000 crore. Major investors Tiger Global and Microsoft are fully exiting their stakes as Walmart, the majority owner, reduces its shareholding. This move marks the first Indian venture from Walmart to go public, following a confidential IPO filing last September.

articles.title: Government tells missions to push exports
articles.summary: Indian missions are being instructed by the PMO and commerce department to prioritize trade engagement with all countries, regardless of current export size. This strategic shift aims to diversify India's export basket and import sources, with embassies tasked with identifying and pursuing opportunities in markets of all scales to build future growth.

articles.title: “She sues people”: Candace Owens takes aim at Nicola Peltz while discussing Brooklyn Beckham’s allegations
articles.summary: Candace Owens criticized Brooklyn Beckham after he publicly accused his parents of undermining his marriage to Nicola Peltz. On her podcast, Owens questioned his decision to cut off family contact, blamed Peltz’s influence, and mocked the wedding disputes cited as reasons for the rift, fueling further debate around the highly publicized Beckham family fallout.

articles.title: iShowSpeed responds to criticism over skipping creator collaborations during Africa tour
articles.summary: Popular streamer iShowSpeed addressed criticism regarding his Africa tour, clarifying its focus isn't on influencer collaborations but on showcasing local culture and talent. He explained that tight schedules and pre-arranged visits prevent spontaneous meetups, prioritizing respect for hosts and highlighting those without global platforms. Fans have lauded his mission to present an authentic image of African nations.

articles.title: Vyro offers $300,000 in fan rewards for clipping MrBeast’s Beast Games episodes
articles.summary: YouTube sensation MrBeast has launched Vyro, a new platform empowering fans to earn money by creating short clips from his content. Viewers, dubbed 'clippers,' can earn around $3 per 1,000 views, with payouts sent hourly. A major promotion for 'Beast Games' offers nearly $300,000 in rewards, incentivizing high-quality fan-generated content and expanding creator reach.
